longDef.en: the part of existence that is measured in minutes, days, years, etc., or this process considered as a whole

examples.en: He wants to spend more time with his family.
examples.cn: 他想多花时间陪家人。

examples.en: Time passes so quickly when you're having fun.
examples.cn: 玩得高兴时，时间过得特别快。

examples.en: She grew more and more fascinated by the subject as time went on/by.
examples.cn: 随着时间的推移，她对这门学科越来越着迷。

examples.en: The curtains have faded over/with time (= as years have gone past).
examples.cn: 年深日久，窗帘已经褪色了。

examples.en: You'll forget her in time (= in the future).
examples.cn: 你迟早会忘记她的。

examples.en: Over the course of time (= as years have gone past), holes have formed in the rock.
examples.cn: 随着岁月的流逝，岩石上出现了洞眼。

examples.en: When Paula was ill, I took her some magazines to help her pass the time.
examples.cn: 葆拉生病时，我给她带去一些杂志帮她消磨时间。

examples.en: If you'd taken more time with/over (= spent more time doing) this essay, you could have done it much better.
examples.cn: 如果你在这篇文章上多花些时间，本可以写得好得多。

examples.en: It takes a long time (= many hours are needed) to get from London to Sydney.
examples.cn: 从伦敦到悉尼要花很长时间。

examples.en: We'd save time on our journey (= it would be quicker) if we went by train.
examples.cn: 如果我们坐火车去，就会在旅程上节约时间。

examples.en: I only worked there for a short period of time.
examples.cn: 我只在那儿工作过很短一段时间。

examples.en: The kitchen clock is gaining/losing time (= is going fast/slow).
examples.cn: 厨房的钟快／慢了。

examples.en: My watch has never kept very good time (= been correct).
examples.cn: 我的手表从来都不准。

longDef.en: continuously

examples.en: I wish you'd stop criticizing me all the time.
examples.cn: 我希望你别再没完没了地批评我了。

longDef.en: very quickly or very soon

examples.en: The kids ate their dinner in no time.
examples.cn: 孩子们很快吃完了饭。

examples.en: We'll be home in next to no time.
examples.cn: 我们很快就能回到家。

longDef.en: If you say there is or that you have no time to lose, it means that you must do quickly whatever it is that you want to do.

examples.en: Come on, there's no time to lose, we have to get home before John finds out.
examples.cn: 赶快，没有时间耽搁了，我们必须在约翰发现之前赶到家。

longDef.en: always

examples.en: I will love you for all time.
examples.cn: 我会永远爱你。

longDef.en: that has ever lived or existed

examples.en: She's been called the greatest singer of all time.
examples.cn: 她被称为有史以来最伟大的演唱家。

longDef.en: the system of recording hours used in different parts of the world

examples.en: Greenwich Mean Time
examples.cn: 格林尼治标准时间

examples.en: daylight saving time
examples.cn: 夏令时

longDef.en: an amount of time that you have available to do something

examples.en: I don't know how you find time to do all the things you do.
examples.cn: 我不知道你是怎么抽出时间做所有这些事情的。

examples.en: I thought we'd give her a little more time (= allow her more time) to get the job done.
examples.cn: 我原以为我们会多给她一点儿时间完成工作。

examples.en: I'd like to visit all the museums but time is short (= there is little time left).
examples.cn: 所有的博物馆我都想参观，可时间不够。

longDef.en: If you have time, you have enough time to do something.

examples.en: We don't have much time before the train leaves.
examples.cn: 在火车发车之前我们的时间不多了。

examples.en: Do you have time for a quick drink after work?
examples.cn: 下班后你有没有时间小酌一杯？

examples.en: I'd like to learn to sail, but I don't have the time (= I am too busy).
examples.cn: 我想学驾帆船，可我没时间。

examples.en: I don't have time to go to the shops today.
examples.cn: 我今天没有时间去商店购物。

longDef.en: to not make good use of the hours, etc. that you have available

examples.en: If you'd done your work instead of wasting time on your phone, you'd be finished by now.
examples.cn: 如果你当时继续工作而不是浪费时间玩手机，你现在已经完成任务了。

longDef.en: to not have enough hours, etc. available to finish something you are trying to do

examples.en: She ran out of time and didn't finish the last question.
examples.cn: 她时间不够，最后一道题没有答完。

longDef.en: to not have enough minutes, etc. available

examples.en: I'd like to continue this discussion but we're all out of time.
examples.cn: 我很想继续讨论，但我们的时间不够。

longDef.en: there are no more minutes, hours, etc. available

examples.en: OK, everyone, time's up for this week.
examples.cn: 好了，各位，这星期的就到这里。

longDef.en: a period of time added to the end of a football match because play was stopped during the game, usually to take care of players who were hurt

examples.en: His goal in the third minute of time added on sealed the match.
examples.cn: 他在比赛伤停补时阶段的第三分钟射进一球，决定了比赛的胜利。

longDef.en: a particular period of time for which something has been happening, or that is needed for something

examples.en: After a time, it became clear that nobody was interested in coming to the meetings.
examples.cn: 过了一阵子，情况变得很明显，没有人想来参加会议。

examples.en: They stayed with us for a short time.
examples.cn: 他们跟我们住了很短一段时间。

examples.en: That was the best restaurant I've been to for/in a long time (= a long period has gone past since I went to such a good restaurant).
examples.cn: 那是我很长一段时间以来去过的最好的饭店。

examples.en: It was some time ago that I last heard from her.
examples.cn: 我最后一次收到她的信已有一段时间了。

examples.en: We're going on holiday in two weeks' time (= after two weeks have passed).
examples.cn: 我们过两周要去度假。

examples.en: During her time (= while she was) in office, the prime minister introduced a large number of changes.
examples.cn: 首相在执政期间推行了多项改革。

examples.en: What do you like doing in your spare/free time (= when you are not working)?
examples.cn: 你业余时间喜欢做什么？

longDef.en: to stop work, in order to do something else

examples.en: I asked my boss if I could have some time off (from work) to go to the dentist.
examples.cn: 我问老板我能不能请一会儿假去看牙医。

longDef.en: for a short period

examples.en: For a time, we all thought that Sheila and Frank would get married.
examples.cn: 我们一度都认为希拉和弗兰克会结婚。

longDef.en: for a fairly long period of time

examples.en: I've been doing yoga for some time.
examples.cn: 我做瑜伽已有一段时间。

longDef.en: for a limited period

examples.en: Leave the ironing for the time being - I'll do it later.
examples.cn: 暂且先别烫衣服——我晚些时候来做。

longDef.en: a particular point in the day, as expressed in hours and minutes or shown on a clock, or a particular point in time

examples.en: What time is it?
examples.cn: 现在几点了？

examples.en: "What's the time?" "It's ten o'clock."
examples.cn: “现在什么时间？”“10点钟。”

examples.en: What time do you finishwork?
examples.cn: 你什么时候完成工作？

examples.en: Have you got the time? (= Do you know what time it is?)
examples.cn: 你知道几点了吗？

examples.en: He's teaching his daughter to tell the time (= to recognize what time it is by looking at a clock).
examples.cn: 他在教女儿看钟表。

examples.en: Did you find out the times of the trains to Kiev?
examples.cn: 你查到去基辅的火车的发车时间了吗？

examples.en: The estimated time of arrival/departure of this flight is 11.15.
examples.cn: 这次航班估计在11点15分到达／起飞。

examples.en: Oh dear, is that the (right) time? (= is it really so late?)
examples.cn: 哦，天哪，有这么晚了吗？

examples.en: We always have dinner at the same time every day.
examples.cn: 我们每天总是在同一时间吃晚饭。

examples.en: I was exhausted by the time (= when) I got home.
examples.cn: 我到家时已经筋疲力尽了。

examples.en: When would be a good time for me to call you?
examples.cn: 我什么时候给你打电话合适？

examples.en: "What would be the best time of day for us to deliver the table?" "Oh, any time will be OK."
examples.cn: “我们什么时候送桌子最合适？”“哦，什么时候都行。”

examples.en: Today's temperatures will be normal for the time of year (= will be as they are expected to be in this season).
examples.cn: 今天的气温会和往年此时的平均气温一样。

examples.en: Just think, this time (= at the same particular point during) next week we'll be in Aruba.
examples.cn: 想想吧，下星期这个时候我们就在阿鲁巴岛了。

examples.en: We regret that at the present time (US also at this time) we are unable to supply the products you ordered.
examples.cn: 很遗憾，我们现在无法供应您订的货。

examples.en: The time is fast drawing near/approaching (= it will soon be the time) when we'll have to make a decision.
examples.cn: 我们必须下决心的时刻很快就要到了。

longDef.en: at the particular point when something was thought of or done

examples.en: It seemed like a good idea at the time.
examples.cn: 在当时这似乎是个好主意。

longDef.en: If two things happen at the same time, they happen together.

examples.en: We arrived at the same time.
examples.cn: 我们同时到达。

longDef.en: at a person's present age

examples.en: At his time of life, he ought to be taking things easy.
examples.cn: 他这样年纪应该享享清福了。

longDef.en: a particular point of the day, year, etc. that is suitable for a particular activity, or at which something is expected to happen
longDef.cn: （从事特定活动或某事应该发生的）时间，时候

examples.en: holiday time
examples.cn: 假期

examples.en: party time
examples.cn: 聚会时间

examples.en: Put your toys away now - it's time for bed.
examples.cn: 现在收拾好玩具，该睡觉了。

examples.en: It's time (that) I was leaving.
examples.cn: 我该动身了。

examples.en: Is it time (for us) to go home yet?
examples.cn: 该回家了吗？

examples.en: This is not the time (= not a suitable moment) to be thinking about buying a house.
examples.cn: 现在不是考虑买房子的时候。

examples.en: This is no time (= not a suitable moment) to change your mind.
examples.cn: 现在不是你改变主意的时候。

examples.en: I feel that the time has come (= now is a suitable moment) for me to move on.
examples.cn: 我觉得是我离开的时候了。

examples.en: The repairs to the road were finished two weeks ahead of time (= sooner than was expected).
examples.cn: 道路维修工程提前两星期完成了。

examples.en: Why is it that the buses never run on time (= make their journeys in the expected number of hours, etc.)?
examples.cn: 为什么公交车从不准点？

examples.en: She's grown old before her time (= sooner than she might have been expected to have done).
examples.cn: 她过早地衰老了。

longDef.en: early enough

examples.en: I got home just in time - it's starting to rain.
examples.cn: 我正好及时赶到家——随后就开始下雨了。

examples.en: If we don't hurry up, we won't be in time to catch the train.
examples.cn: 如果我们不赶快，就不能及时赶上火车了。

examples.en: We got there in plenty of time (= we arrived early) for the beginning of the game.
examples.cn: 我们比赛前早早地就到了。

longDef.en: happening or done at the particular moment that it was expected to happen or be done

examples.en: My parents go to the house right on time.
examples.cn: 我父母极为准时地到家。

longDef.en: earlier than a particular moment

examples.en: Let's meet for lunch. I'll call you ahead of time to decide exactly when and where.
examples.cn: 我们见面吃个午饭吧。我会提前打电话跟你定时间和地点。

longDef.en: If it is about time/high time that someone did something, it should have been done sooner or a long time ago.
longDef.cn: 差不多是时候了；早该（做某事）了

examples.en: It's about time (that) the school improved its food service.
examples.cn: 学校早该改善膳食服务了。

examples.en: It is high time for the critics to open their minds to a new approach.
examples.cn: 是到了批评者们对新做法采取开放态度的时候了。

longDef.en: said when someone does something or something happens that you think should have been done or have happened much sooner
longDef.cn: （表示某人早该做某事了或某事早该发生了）早该如此

examples.en: "So Ben's finally found a job." "Yeah, it's about time."
examples.cn: “这么说，本终于找到工作了。”“对，早就该找到了。”

longDef.en: it is the most suitable moment to do something or for something to happen

examples.en: I haven't told him yet, but I will when the time is right.
examples.cn: 我目前还没有告诉他，时机成熟的时候我会的。

examples.en: She felt the time was right to leave.
examples.cn: 她觉得是时候该离开了。

examples.en: The time is ripe for investing in new technology.
examples.cn: 投资新技术的时机成熟了。

longDef.en: an occasion when something happens, or the experience connected with it

examples.en: The last time we went to Paris, it rained every day.
examples.cn: 上一次我们去巴黎的时候，每天都下雨。

examples.en: Every time/Each time I ask you to do something you say you're busy.
examples.cn: 每次我叫你做事，你都说太忙。

examples.en: They go swimming three or four times a week.
examples.cn: 他们每周去游泳三四次。

examples.en: There are times when I wish I didn't live where I do.
examples.cn: 有时我真希望我不是住在现在的地方。

examples.en: The four-times champion (= the champion on four occasions in the past) was defeated in the second round.
examples.cn: 这名曾4度夺冠的选手在比赛的第二轮就被打败了。

examples.en: If I'd known at the time (= then) that she was his former wife, I'd never have said what I did.
examples.cn: 我当时要是知道她是他前妻的话，我就不会那样说了。

examples.en: Sometimes I enjoy my English classes, but at other times I find them really boring.
examples.cn: 有时我很喜欢英语课，但有时也感觉很枯燥。

examples.en: For the umpteenth/hundredth/thousandth time, (= I've told you on many occasions to) stop teasing your sister.
examples.cn: 我无数次／上百次／上千次告诉过你，别再戏弄你妹妹了。

examples.en: Did you have a bad/good time (= an unpleasant/enjoyable experience) at the conference?
examples.cn: 你会开得好／不好吗？

examples.en: She had an easy/hard time of it (= a comfortable/uncomfortable experience) with the birth of her second baby.
examples.cn: 她生第二个孩子时很顺利／艰难。

longDef.en: sometimes, but not often

examples.en: From time to time I still think of her.
examples.cn: 我偶尔还会想起她。

longDef.en: again and again

examples.en: Time after time she gets involved in relationships with the wrong men.
examples.cn: 她一次次地与不般配的男人陷入情感纠葛。

longDef.en: very often

examples.en: I've told you time and time again - look before you cross the road.
examples.cn: 我多次跟你说过——过马路之前要先看一看。

longDef.en: continuously

examples.en: When you're at the airport, you should make sure you have your luggage with you at all times.
examples.cn: 在机场，要把行李一直带在你身边。

longDef.en: at or during any particular point or moment in the day

examples.en: Only a certain number of people are allowed in the building at any one time.
examples.cn: 该建筑任何时候都只允许一定数量的人员进入。

examples.en: I'm sorry, but I'm too busy to help you now - I can only do one thing at a time.
examples.cn: 对不起，我现在太忙了，不能帮你——我一次只能做一件事。

longDef.en: sometimes

examples.en: You can be really annoying at times, you know.
examples.cn: 要知道，你有时很令人恼火。

longDef.en: ever

examples.en: Parking is not allowed here at any time.
examples.cn: 这里任何时候都不得停车。

longDef.en: on many occasions

examples.en: The times I've told you, ask before you borrow my clothes.
examples.cn: 我已经告诉你许多次了，在借用我的衣服之前要先问一声。

longDef.en: a period in history

examples.en: "A Tale of Two Cities" is set at the time of the French Revolution.
examples.cn: 小说《双城记》是以法国大革命时期为背景的。

examples.en: In/During medieval times, women thought to be witches were burned at the stake.
examples.cn: 中世纪时期，人们把被认为是女巫的女人烧死在火刑柱上。

examples.en: In times gone by, all crops were harvested by hand.
examples.cn: 在过去的时代里，所有的农作物都是手工收割的。

examples.en: Times were hard (= living conditions were not good) when I was a boy.
examples.cn: 我小时候日子很艰难。

examples.en: He is widely regarded as one of the best writers of modern/our times (= the present or very recent past).
examples.cn: 人们普遍认为他是现代／我们这个时代最优秀的作家之一。

examples.en: I never thought it would happen in my time (= before I died).
examples.cn: 我怎么也想不到这会在我有生之年发生。

examples.en: We sat and talked about old times (= things that had happened to us in the past.)
examples.cn: 我们坐下来谈论往事。

examples.en: Times have changed and many more women now have executive jobs than in the past.
examples.cn: 时代已经变了，置身高级管理职位的女性数量比过去多得多了。

longDef.en: in the past

examples.en: At one time, George Eliot lived here.
examples.cn: 乔治‧艾略特曾一度住在这里。

longDef.en: having new ideas, opinions, or ways of living long before most other people do
longDef.cn: 领先时代的，超越时代的

longDef.en: If something is before your time, it happened or existed before you were born or were old enough to remember it.

examples.en: I don't remember the Beatles - they were before my time.
examples.cn: 我对甲壳虫乐队没有什么印象——那是我出生前的事。

longDef.en: said to mean that there was a period in the past when something used to happen or be true

examples.en: Time was (when) you could buy a loaf of bread for sixpence.
examples.cn: 过去，你花6便士就能买到一条面包。

longDef.en: Your time in a race is the number of minutes, hours, etc. you take to complete it.

examples.en: Her time for the marathon was just under three hours.
examples.cn: 她的马拉松成绩略低于3小时。

examples.en: He ran the 100 metres in record time.
examples.cn: 他以创纪录的成绩完成了100米赛跑。

longDef.en: the number of beats in a bar of music, or the speed at which a piece of music is intended to be played

examples.en: This piece is written in 4/4 time.
examples.cn: 这支曲子是四四拍的。

examples.en: Small children often have difficulty singing in time with the music (= at the same speed at which the music is being played).
examples.cn: 幼儿唱歌时常常难以与音乐合拍。

examples.en: It seemed to me as if the violins were playing out of time (= at a different speed from the other instruments playing the same piece of music).
examples.cn: 我觉得小提琴似乎不合拍。

examples.en: To beat time is to make a regular series of sounds at the same speed as a piece of music is played.
examples.cn: 打拍子就是跟着音乐的节奏制造出一系列有规律的声响。

examples.en: Tapping your foot will help you to keep time (= to play the music at the correct speed).
examples.cn: 用脚轻叩有助于你跟上节拍。

longDef.en: to spend a period of time in prison

examples.en: It's not always easy to find a job after you've done time.
examples.cn: 出狱后要找到工作可不容易。

longDef.en: the particular point in the day at which people who are drinking in a bar in the UK have to finish their drinks and leave

examples.en: "Time, please!" called the landlord.
examples.cn: “对不起，要打烊了，”店主叫道。

examples.en: Is it time already?
examples.cn: 已经到打烊的时间了吗？

longDef.en: to decide that something will happen at a particular time
longDef.cn: 确定…的时间，为…安排时间

examples.en: We timed our trip to coincide with my cousin's wedding.
examples.cn: 我们把旅行安排在表哥结婚的时候。

longDef.en: to arrange something so that it happens at the best possible time

examples.en: If you time your departure carefully, you should be able to miss the worst of the traffic.
examples.cn: 如果精心安排好出发的时间，你应该能够避开交通堵塞最严重的时段。

examples.en: The girls' basketball team won the game with a perfectly timed shot (= one played at exactly the right moment), just before the buzzer.
examples.cn: 女子少年篮球队完美地掌握时机，在比赛结束哨响前一刻投篮进球，赢得了这场比赛。

longDef.en: to measure how long it takes for something to happen or for someone to do something
longDef.cn: 为…计时，测定…所需的时间

examples.en: Will you time me to see how long it takes me to swim a length?
examples.cn: 请你给我测一下游一个单程要花多少时间好吗？

longDef.en: the stated period of time during the year, day, etc.

examples.en: springtime
examples.cn: 春季

examples.en: Christmas-time
examples.cn: 圣诞节的时候

examples.en: daytime
examples.cn: 白天

examples.en: night-time
examples.cn: 夜晚
